chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gregory John Greer was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
State moves to Amend Ct #1 to OWI 3rd, as out of state matter is not yet resolved.  Court approves.  DE pleads No Contest to amended count.   Found Guilty.  Sentence imposed:    The defendant shall serve 110 days, with Huber, in home detention/electronic monitoring pursuant to section 973.03(4), to be monitored by the STOP program.  Report to STOP today.
Fine/costs $3264.00    Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge which is included in the fine.  DL revoked 30 months.  IID 30 months plus 110 days on any vehicle owned or operated.     OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.

Defendant Gregory John Greer in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.   Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of information. Not guilty plea. Going to STOP.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Also to 15 CF 260
Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
